required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Lower Limb Strength Training Program on a Seated Robotic Device in Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Lower Limb Strength Training Program on a Seated Robotic Device in Subacute Stroke Patients: a Pilot Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The loss of lower limb strength that occurs after a stroke limits the patient's autonomy in participating in activities of daily living, including gait performance. In the sub-acute phase, it is difficult to implement a strengthening program, as weakness prevents exercise being performed with the recommended parameters. This limit can be exceeded by using specific robotic devices, which allow the effort provided to be adapted according to the patient's capacities. In addition, motivation can be improved by the use of feedback or incentive games. The aim of this pilot study is to obtain data on the effect of lower limb strength training with a seated robotic device in subacute stroke patients for a future larger randomised study. In addition, it aims to evaluate the recruitment rate, applicability, resources for implementation and patient tolerance to the training program.

primary_outcome.measure: change from study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks in strength of knee extensor's
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: measure with a manuel dynamometer, in newton

secondary_outcome.measure: change from study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks in Motricity index legs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: clinical manuel strength test, seating on a chair. From 0 to 33, 33 is normal strength.

secondary_outcome.measure: change from study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks in timed up and go
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mobility test: standing from a chair, walking 3 meters, turn around, returning and seat. in seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: change from study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks in 10 meters walk test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: measure of mean gait speed on 10 meters, at comfortable and maximum gait speed. In meters/second.

secondary_outcome.measure: change from study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks in Ashworth Scale (spasticity)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study inclusion to end of intervention at 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: measure of the resistance of a muscle to passive stretch according to REsistance to PASsive movement protocol. From 0 to 4, 4 is high spasticity.

arm_group.description: group focus on lower limb strength training with a seated robotic device
physiotherapy group as usual, not focused on strength training

intervention.description: 2x a week during 5 weeks, strengthening of weak muscles with the intensity recommended in the literature, i.e. 3-4x15 repetition at an intensity of 50 to 80% of the maximum force combined with serious games to stimulate patient involvement in strength training

intervention.intervention_name: Group of physiotherapy not focus on strength training
intervention.description: 2x a week during 5 weeks, active physical therapy treatment based on movement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cerebral vascular accident of hemorrhagic or ischemic origin for more than 72 hours
- Walking ability ≤ Functional Ambulatory Category level 4 (1-6)
- Paresis of the lower limb: strength <57/100 on the Motricity Index
- Cognitive and memory functions allowing the patient to follow treatment instructions and give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant heart problem
- Venous thrombosis less than 6 months
- Musculoskeletal impairment not compatible with movement
- Other neurological impairment
- Oxygen-dependent
- Blood pressure not stabilized
